intro: Magydaris pastinacea, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. The yellow bellflower is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
